data.text: Very sad to hear of Paddy's demise. We had many different views but he was a very good man.

The student loans system is broken. Graduates are not getting value for money and vast amounts of debt will never be repaid. We need reform that gives young people a choice, real value for money and real opportunities. https://t.co/BQxXQ3N7Ji
Andrew Mitchell calls for an extension of Article 50 in @10DowningStreet statement. Wrong call at this time.
There exists a credible alternative to the present Brexit shambles. We must take it, seize the Brexit prize, and give the people of Britain the future they deserve. https://t.co/AOJKj3zc3V

Next year's Police Funding Settlement will see an additional £1.9m provided to help @Humberbeat with the cost of increased pension contributions. An extra £2.4m will also be available to spend on local policing priorities. An excellent outcome for residents across Humberside.
RT @bbcquestiontime: Conservative MP @DavidDavisMP is on the #bbcqt panel https://t.co/WuMc9eyAlY
Now is the moment to seize control and deliver our own destiny. Continually kicking the can down the road is not a valid strategy. We must not shirk from the tough decisions. https://t.co/02zA7zC8YD

It was an absolute pleasure to catch up with @DUPleader, Arlene Foster, this morning. We shared a platform for the release of "A Better Deal" - a plan for an improved Withdrawal Agreement. It's vital that we push for a real alternative to the Government's proposal.
You can read a full copy of my speech here: https://t.co/yeiQJtII7N

Tonight I gave the 5th Margaret Thatcher Lecture. I spoke of the lessons we can learn from her today. How would she tackle the issues of the day - social mobility, policing, housing, tuition fees and welfare? @Conservatives must rediscover our ambition for meritocracy.

I have urged the Prime Minister to go to Brussels and push for a time-limited Northern Ireland backstop. As it stands, the Withdrawal Agreement hands all the negotiating power to the EU. It fails to take back control of our laws, our borders or our money.https://t.co/25ALfGYL4E
We need a new strategy of hope, vision and imagination. Next Tuesday is make or break; it’s time to defeat this wretched deal and get on with the future. https://t.co/IvCLNhBlmn

The Conservative Party has a key role in this. That role is not to attempt to bully MPs into support for a failed strategy. Our role is to come together to find a joint approach that supports the decision of the referendum and promotes the national interest.

To do this, we need to preserve our freedom of action on trade, on regulations, on migration, on fishing. We must not subordinate ourselves to partisan foreign institutions. Democracy demands no less.
We will be judged in the future as to whether we flinched in the face of unfounded threats and panic, or stood up for our national interest and took our proper place in the world.

It is a common cliché of political speeches that we stand at a turning point in history. For once, however, it is true. The decisions taken in the next few months will dictate our nation's future for a generation.

The Government's deal is not Brexit. Whilst no-deal should not be feared, we have within our grasp a Canada-style deal which delivers a true Brexit. This is what 17.4 million people voted for in June 2016. https://t.co/MMFYfsBD7o
RT @libertyhq: Thanks @TulipSiddiq, @DavidDavisMP, @spelmanc, Dominic Grieve and Andrew Mitchell for raising and supporting this important…

We need to put an end to dodgy dossiers and scare stories. As I say in today's Sunday Times, it's time to seize this opportunity and grasp the fabulous future that the United Kingdom is offered. https://t.co/kxI1M1NYKf

This proposal will keep Britain in orbit around the EU. We will be nothing more than a satellite state ruled from afar. It is our duty to reject that prospectus and genuinely take back control. https://t.co/d6aGDw7I78

Downing Street and the Treasury will argue they are delivering a clean Brexit. But the facts point in the opposite direction. The Withdrawal Agreement and the Political Declaration are a bogus prospectus.

The task facing the Conservative Party, the governing party, is to deliver the will of the people as set out in June 2016. That means Brexit – and it means a clean Brexit that ensures a decisive break from the influence of a foreign power.

At this point all the choking tentacles of the EU fall away. No customs union. No backstop. No single market. No denial of new trade deals. No money paid over. No threat to the integrity of the Union.

If intransigence from Brussels denies this, we should announce an exit on WTO terms and accelerate preparations for such an outcome. We should press for an exit on a Canada+++ free trade basis. If that is denied to us by Brussels intransigence, we'll have to leave on WTO terms.
If Parliament rejects the Government's current proposal, then the Government can press for a Canada+++ free trade deal backed by technical solutions on the Irish border.

They said that in the 18 months after the referendum the economy would contract by at best 0.1 per cent and at worst 2.1 per cent. Instead, it GREW by 2.8 per cent. This is an error of 4.9% - up to £100 billion.
The Treasury’s forecasts in the past have almost never been right and have more often been dramatically wrong. Take their forecasts for the effects of a Leave vote made in May 2016.

Earlier, I urged the PM to withhold part of the £39 billion divorce bill until we get a comprehensive free trade agreement. If the EU is serious about agreeing a good deal, they should be happy to oblige.

https://t.co/8v5vyi0SA4

This deal is not what the people voted for. It will tie us to the Customs Union for years to come with no way out. But there is still time to negotiate a Canada+++ deal that delivers on the referendum. So let’s get on with it. https://t.co/vkztgWyC7W

Earlier I had useful discussions at the US Department of Agriculture. An amazing building, built in the Great Depression. It’s the 3rd largest government building, put up in a hurry on plans based on Leavenworth prison. Very long corridors, you can walk on a 2.3 mile round trip! https://t.co/8YXISZN7qR
We have to have a Canada+++ deal to allow us to have a free trade deal with America
This will not be possible if we accept the Government's proposed deal with Europe, which will block every avenue of negotiation with America.

I have spent the last few days in Washington talking to US Government Trade and Treasury officials encouraging a free trade deal with the UK. Excellent response. They have already started on the procedures to allow negotiations to start immediately once we leave the EU in March.

.@Tracey_Crouch was right to take a stand over Fixed Odds Betting Terminals. The Government must not prevaricate any longer on reducing the maximum stake. That is why I am supporting amendments to make it happen sooner rather than later.

This is the moment of truth. This is the fork in the road. Do we pursue a future as an independent nation or accept EU domination, imprisonment in the customs union and 2nd class status. Cabinet and all Conservative MPs should stand up, be counted and say no to this capitulation.

Pleased that the Government has made the sensible decision to agree to release the legal advice on the backstop. I called for this in The Sunday Times earlier this month. Done at the appropriate time, it will allow for a sensible decision without undermining the negotiations.

100 years ago today Canadian Forces liberated the city of Mons. It was great to see a strong Canadian representation at commemorative services held across the weekend. Today is a day to reflect on the immense sacrifices made for our freedom. #LestWeForget. https://t.co/wFE1z17Pjn
Yesterday I also met the granddaughter of George Ellison, the last British soldier to die in WW1. Lovely lady.

Sorry to see @JoJohnsonUK resign. He's right that the Government's current proposals are "a travesty of Brexit" and represent a huge democratic deficit - out of Europe but run by Europe. However, a 2nd referendum is not the way forward and is not supported by the public.

If reports are true regarding concessions on fishing and a border in the Irish Sea, then this is not the Brexit that people voted for. If the EU will not negotiate in good faith then we must assume that WTO is still better than what looks like a bad deal.

The Cabinet and Parliament must be able to make a fully informed decision on any future relationship with the EU. Earlier, on @BBCr4today, I reiterated the need for the Government to release the full legal advice provided by the Attorney General. https://t.co/Z1tjVpx4JR

Deeply saddened to hear of Jeremy Heywood's passing. He served this country with the utmost professionalism and dedication. My thoughts are with his family and friends.

tweets.text: Conservative MP @DavidDavisMP is on the #bbcqt panel https://t.co/WuMc9eyAlY

Tonight I gave the 5th Margaret Thatcher Lecture. I spoke of the lessons we can learn from her today. How would she tackle the issues of the day - social mobility, policing, housing, tuition fees and welfare? @Conservatives must rediscover our ambition for meritocracy.

To do this, we need to preserve our freedom of action on trade, on regulations, on migration, on fishing. We must not subordinate ourselves to partisan foreign institutions. Democracy demands no less.
We will be judged in the future as to whether we flinched in the face of unfounded threats and panic, or stood up for our national interest and took our proper place in the world.

It is a common cliché of political speeches that we stand at a turning point in history. For once, however, it is true. The decisions taken in the next few months will dictate our nation's future for a generation.

Thanks @TulipSiddiq, @DavidDavisMP, @spelmanc, Dominic Grieve and Andrew Mitchell for raising and supporting this important cause! 
Whoever you are, wherever you’re from, you deserve to be treated with dignity and fairness #Time4aTimeLimit https://t.co/c4sHFpIxjG

Downing Street and the Treasury will argue they are delivering a clean Brexit. But the facts point in the opposite direction. The Withdrawal Agreement and the Political Declaration are a bogus prospectus.

The task facing the Conservative Party, the governing party, is to deliver the will of the people as set out in June 2016. That means Brexit – and it means a clean Brexit that ensures a decisive break from the influence of a foreign power.

At this point all the choking tentacles of the EU fall away. No customs union. No backstop. No single market. No denial of new trade deals. No money paid over. No threat to the integrity of the Union.

If intransigence from Brussels denies this, we should announce an exit on WTO terms and accelerate preparations for such an outcome. We should press for an exit on a Canada+++ free trade basis. If that is denied to us by Brussels intransigence, we'll have to leave on WTO terms.
If Parliament rejects the Government's current proposal, then the Government can press for a Canada+++ free trade deal backed by technical solutions on the Irish border.

They said that in the 18 months after the referendum the economy would contract by at best 0.1 per cent and at worst 2.1 per cent. Instead, it GREW by 2.8 per cent. This is an error of 4.9% - up to £100 billion.
The Treasury’s forecasts in the past have almost never been right and have more often been dramatically wrong. Take their forecasts for the effects of a Leave vote made in May 2016.
This Brexit deal is a capitulation - pass it and our party will sleepwalk into electoral defeat, @DavidDavisMP blogs https://t.co/0qPNivgp7i
We have to have a Canada+++ deal to allow us to have a free trade deal with America
This will not be possible if we accept the Government's proposed deal with Europe, which will block every avenue of negotiation with America.

I have spent the last few days in Washington talking to US Government Trade and Treasury officials encouraging a free trade deal with the UK. Excellent response. They have already started on the procedures to allow negotiations to start immediately once we leave the EU in March.

“There’s a big majority against this policy in the House of Commons. I’ve been putting up the alternative as persuasively as I can. I’ve persuaded a large part of the Conservative Party and others, and we’ll put that back to the EU” @DavidDavisMP
